name: upstreams
description: The upstream object represents a virtual hostname and can be used to load balance incoming requests over multiple services (targets)

fields.name: name
fields.help: This is a hostname, which must be equal to the host of a Service.

fields.name: algorithm
fields.help: What to use as hashing input. Using none results in a weighted-round-robin scheme with no hashing. Accepted values are: "none", "consumer", "ip", "header", "cookie". Defaults to "none".

fields.name: hash_on
fields.help: What to use as hashing input. Using none results in a weighted-round-robin scheme with no hashing. Accepted values are: "none", "consumer", "ip", "header", "cookie". Defaults to "none".

fields.name: hash_fallback
fields.help: What to use as hashing input if the primary hash_on does not return a hash (eg. header is missing, or no consumer identified). Not available if hash_on is set to cookie. Accepted values are: "none", "consumer", "ip", "header", "cookie". Defaults to "none".

fields.name: hash_on_header
fields.help: The header name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when hash_on is set to header.

fields.name: hash_fallback_header
fields.help: The header name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when hash_fallback is set to header.

fields.name: hash_on_cookie
fields.help: The cookie name to take the value from as hash input. Only required when hash_on or hash_fallback is set to cookie. If the specified cookie is not in the request, Kong will generate a value and set the cookie in the response.

fields.name: hash_on_cookie_path
fields.help: The cookie path to set in the response headers. Only required when hash_on or hash_fallback is set to cookie. Defaults to "/".

fields.name: slots
fields.help: The number of slots in the loadbalancer algorithm (10-65536). Defaults to 10000.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.https_verify_certificate
fields.help: Whether to check the validity of the SSL certificate of the remote host when performing active health checks using HTTPS. Defaults to true.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.unhealthy.http_statuses
fields.help: An array of HTTP statuses to consider a failure, indicating unhealthiness, when returned by a probe in active health checks. Defaults to [429, 404, 500, 501, 502, 503, 504, 505]. With form-encoded, the notation is http_statuses[]=429&http_statuses[]=404. With JSON, use an Array.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.unhealthy.tcp_failures
fields.help: Number of TCP failures in active probes to consider a target unhealthy. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.unhealthy.timeouts
fields.help: Number of timeouts in active probes to consider a target unhealthy. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.unhealthy.http_failures
fields.help: Number of HTTP failures in active probes (as defined by healthchecks.active.unhealthy.http_statuses) to consider a target unhealthy. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.unhealthy.interval
fields.help: Interval between active health checks for unhealthy targets (in seconds). A value of zero indicates that active probes for unhealthy targets should not be performed. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.http_path
fields.help: Path to use in GET HTTP request to run as a probe on active health checks. Defaults to "/".

fields.name: healthchecks.active.timeout
fields.help: Socket timeout for active health checks (in seconds). Defaults to 1.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.healthy.http_statuses
fields.help: An array of HTTP statuses to consider a success, indicating healthiness, when returned by a probe in active health checks. Defaults to [200, 302]. With form-encoded, the notation is http_statuses[]=200&http_statuses[]=302. With JSON, use an Array.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.healthy.interval
fields.help: Interval between active health checks for healthy targets (in seconds). A value of zero indicates that active probes for healthy targets should not be performed. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.healthy.successes
fields.help: Number of successes in active probes (as defined by healthchecks.active.healthy.http_statuses) to consider a target healthy. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.https_sni
fields.help: The hostname to use as an SNI (Server Name Identification) when performing active health checks using HTTPS. This is particularly useful when Targets are configured using IPs, so that the target host’s certificate can be verified with the proper SNI.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.concurrency
fields.help: Number of targets to check concurrently in active health checks. Defaults to 10.

fields.name: healthchecks.active.type
fields.help: Whether to perform active health checks using HTTP or HTTPS, or just attempt a TCP connection. Accepted values are: "tcp", "http", "https", "grpc", "grpcs". Defaults to "http".

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.unhealthy.http_failures
fields.help: Number of HTTP failures in proxied traffic (as defined by healthchecks.passive.unhealthy.http_statuses) to consider a target unhealthy, as observed by passive health checks. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.unhealthy.http_statuses
fields.help: An array of HTTP statuses which represent unhealthiness when produced by proxied traffic, as observed by passive health checks. Defaults to [429, 500, 503]. With form-encoded, the notation is http_statuses[]=429&http_statuses[]=500. With JSON, use an Array.

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.unhealthy.tcp_failures
fields.help: Number of TCP failures in proxied traffic to consider a target unhealthy, as observed by passive health checks. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.unhealthy.timeouts
fields.help: Number of timeouts in proxied traffic to consider a target unhealthy, as observed by passive health checks. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.type
fields.help: Whether to perform passive health checks interpreting HTTP/HTTPS statuses, or just check for TCP connection success. In passive checks, http and https options are equivalent. Accepted values are: "tcp", "http", "https", "grpc", "grpcs". Defaults to "http".

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.healthy.successes
fields.help: Number of successes in proxied traffic (as defined by healthchecks.passive.healthy.http_statuses) to consider a target healthy, as observed by passive health checks. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: healthchecks.passive.healthy.http_statuses
fields.help: An array of HTTP statuses which represent healthiness when produced by proxied traffic, as observed by passive health checks. Defaults to [200, 201, 202, 203, 204, 205, 206, 207, 208, 226, 300, 301, 302, 303, 304, 305, 306, 307, 308]. With form-encoded, the notation is http_statuses[]=200&http_statuses[]=201. With JSON, use an Array.

fields.name: healthchecks.threshold
fields.help: The minimum percentage of the upstream’s targets’ weight that must be available for the whole upstream to be considered healthy. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: tags
fields.help: An optional set of strings associated with the Upstream, for grouping and filtering.

fields.name: host_header
fields.help: The hostname to be used as Host header when proxying requests through Kong.
